claim: The first-through-twelfth-grade California school with the largest enrollment adopted a grizzly bear as its mascot in 2007.
reasoning: The K-12 school with the largest enrollment is River Springs Charter (5,333 students), but the database contains no mascot information in any table. There is no way to verify the claim about adopting a grizzly bear mascot in 2007.

Get full schema of all tables

content.content:
CREATE TABLE frpm
(
    CDSCode                                       TEXT not null
        primary key,
    `Academic Year`                               TEXT  null,
    `County Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `District Code`                               INTEGER         null,
    `School Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `County Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Name`                               TEXT null,
    `School Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Type`                               TEXT null,
    `School Type`                                 TEXT null,
    `Educational Option Type`                     TEXT null,
    `NSLP Provision Status`                       TEXT null,
    `Charter School (Y/N)`                        INTEGER    null,
    `Charter School Number`                       TEXT  null,
    `Charter Funding Type`                        TEXT null,
    IRC                                           INTEGER    null,
    `Low Grade`                                   TEXT  null,
    `High Grade`                                  TEXT null,
    `Enrollment (K-12)`                           REAL      null,
    `Free Meal Count (K-12)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (K-12)`                           REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)`                 REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status` INTEGER    null,
    foreign key (CDSCode) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE satscores
(
    cds         TEXT not null
        primary key,
    rtype       TEXT  not null,
    sname       TEXT null,
    dname       TEXT null,
    cname       TEXT null,
    enroll12    INTEGER         not null,
    NumTstTakr  INTEGER          not null,
    AvgScrRead  INTEGER          null,
    AvgScrMath  INTEGER          null,
    AvgScrWrite INTEGER          null,
    NumGE1500   INTEGER          null,
--     PctGE1500   double      null,
        foreign key (cds) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE schools
(
    CDSCode     TEXT not null
        primary key,
    NCESDist    TEXT  null,
    NCESSchool  TEXT  null,
    StatusType  TEXT  not null,
    County      TEXT not null,
    District    TEXT not null,
    School      TEXT null,
    Street      TEXT null,
    StreetAbr   TEXT null,
    City        TEXT null,
    Zip         TEXT null,
    State       TEXT  null,
    MailStreet  TEXT null,
    MailStrAbr  TEXT null,
    MailCity    TEXT null,
    MailZip     TEXT null,
    MailState   TEXT  null,
    Phone       TEXT null,
    Ext         TEXT  null,
    Website     TEXT null,
    OpenDate    DATE        null,
    ClosedDate  DATE        null,
    Charter     INTEGER    null,
    CharterNum  TEXT  null,
    FundingType TEXT null,
    DOC         TEXT  not null,
    DOCType     TEXT not null,
    SOC         TEXT  null,
    SOCType     TEXT null,
    EdOpsCode   TEXT  null,
    EdOpsName   TEXT null,
    EILCode     TEXT  null,
    EILName     TEXT null,
    GSoffered   TEXT null,
    GSserved    TEXT  null,
    Virtual     TEXT  null,
    Magnet      INTEGER   null,
    Latitude    REAL      null,
    Longitude   REAL      null,
    AdmFName1   TEXT null,
    AdmLName1   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail1   TEXT null,
    AdmFName2   TEXT null,
    AdmLName2   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail2   TEXT null,
    AdmFName3   TEXT  null,
    AdmLName3   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail3   TEXT null,
    LastUpdate  DATE        not null
);

content.thinking:
The claim says "K-12" school (first-through-twelfth-grade). The hint says K-12 means first-through-twelfth-grade. Let me check which schools have grades K-12 specifically, and find the one with the largest enrollment. Let me also check the GSoffered column in the schools table, and look for mascot information.

Wait, the frpm table has "Enrollment (K-12)" which is the enrollment count for K-12 students, but that doesn't mean the school itself is a K-12 school. The "Low Grade" and "High Grade" columns might indicate what grades the school serves. 

I need to find schools where the grade range spans K through 12 using the Low Grade and High Grade columns. River Springs Charter appears to be a K-12 school based on those columns, so let me verify if it has the largest enrollment among K-12 schools.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT f.CDSCode, f.\"School Name\", f.\"Enrollment (K-12)\", f.\"Low Grade\", f.\"High Grade\" FROM frpm f WHERE f.\"Low Grade\" = 'K' AND f.\"High Grade\" = '12' ORDER BY f.\"Enrollment (K-12)\" DESC LIMIT 5;"

So the answer is NOT ENOUGH INFO, because while we can identify the K-12 school with the largest enrollment (River Springs Charter), the database doesn't contain any information about mascots.

content.text:
The database identifies **River Springs Charter** as the K-12 school with the largest enrollment (5,333 students). However, none of the three tables (`frpm`, `satscores`, `schools`) contain any columns related to school mascots. There is no way to verify whether River Springs Charter (or any school) adopted a grizzly bear as its mascot in 2007.
